Introduction

This facility is owned and operated by Vertex Chemical Corporation (based in Roseville, Minnesota) and is a subsidiary of Hawkins, Inc.  Vertex was purchased by Hawkins in 2011.  Hawkins corporate office now oversees all aspects of this program and the Vertex facility works closely with the corporate office to stay in compliance, so both Hawkins and Vertex names will be used in the Risk Management Plan.



Hawkins and Vertex are very similar in nature, both in how they started out, and chemicals handled.  Both started out as small family owned businesses (Hawkins started in 1938 and Vertex in 1949).  Both have a long history of manufacturing sodium hypochlorite and using chlorine - the only chemical regulated by both PSM and RMP at this facility.  Both are active members in the Chlorine Institute and adhere to their guidelines.  The merging of these two companies has made both companies stronger as best practices are reviewed and the utilization of combined resources occur (employee knowledge, equipment, outside resources, etc.).  Hawkins is a publicly traded company.



This facility batch manufactures sodium hypochlorite using chlorine, sodium hydroxide and water, providing water and waste-water treatment, pulp and paper, and pool chemicals to improve the quality of life and operate in concert with the environment.



Vertex Chemical Corporation has been using this process to manufacture bleach since 1968 and started manufacturing in Dupo in 1969.  In 1998 a new Dupo manufacturing building was created with additional safety features.  



The Dupo facility is sited remote from immediate population groups, in an industrial/rail yard area with space, fences, security, natural obstacles separating the areas from casual public.  Secondary security fencing is located around the chlorine rail car unloading area to keep unauthorized personnel away from the chlorine unloading area.  Batch process is set up as close as possible to the chlorine railcars to red

uce pipeline distance which reduces the hazard of mechanical failure and how much chlorine would be released in a pipeline failure.



Executive Summary 

Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  Hawkins' management and safety committees have set a motto of "Think Safe! Be Safe!" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this motto is manifested in several ways, including:

1.    A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental (HSE) department staffed with trained professionals.

2.    Training programs in chemical safety, safe material handling, accident prevention and emergency response.

3.    Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to prevent future occurrences.

4.    Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.

5.    Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping and materials.

6.    Internal and 3rd party audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.

7.    Members in good standing with the Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Chemical Distributors.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  This facility is a chemical distribution and manufacturing facility that handles several products used to protect public health by treating water, wastewater, swimming pools and other uses.  For example, this facility supplies bleach used in disinfection at food processors and health facilities.  This site manufactures sodium hypochlorite which uses chlorine in the process.  Chlorine is regulated by the EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) and OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM).  The only chemical covered by Process Safety Management and Risk Management Plan for this facility is chlorine.
